    public class MainActivity
extends android.support.v7.app.AppCompatActivity
implements android.location.LocationListener

    MPSIT Location Manager

    The MPSIT Location is a tiny little Android program that gets the current location of the mobile device using either GPS or network and sends this location via HTTP to a Mapbeats node.js server backend, responsible for showing user's location, with a unique ID. Application offers a ListView with settings: Force GPS use and Check Network connectivity status If it were to be implemented with buttons, then the application should have also implement the View.onClickListener interface
    Since:
    2016-01-26
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Mihai Barbulescu, Mihnea Dobrescu-Balaur

        Returns:
        ture in case mobile device is connected to internet. Also a TextView regarding connectivity information is set.

      • geoDecodeAddr

        public void geoDecodeAddr(double lat,
                 double lng)
        Function to get decoding of address based on latitude and longitude. A TextView is set in application with the decoded address
        Parameters:
        lat - Latitude (double)
        lng - Longitude (double)

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Function which checks, using connectivity manager, whether the mobile device is connected or not to the internet using wi-fi or mobile network
        Returns:
        boolean true if connected, false otherwise

      • postData

        public java.lang.String postData(java.lang.String url,
                        org.json.JSONObject obj)
        Function which makes HTTP request to server to place a pinpoint on the location determined by the mobile device. The HTTP request is of type application/json
        Parameters:
        url - Address to which mobile device should connect for sending location
        obj - a JSON containing latitude, longitude and a unique identifier
        Returns:

      • handleListViewClicks

        public void handleListViewClicks(int pos)
        Function responsible for handling the clicks performed by the user on the settings ListView
        Parameters:
        pos - an integer identifying position (index) in ListView. If 0, it means that Internet connectivity was required, if 1 it means that user wants to force use of GPS sensors
